title: Fostering the Future for American Children and Families

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the modernization and improvement of the foster care system, aiming to better support children in foster care and those transitioning out of it. It calls for updating data systems, increasing caregiver recruitment, expanding educational and employment opportunities, and strengthening partnerships with faith-based organizations to serve children and families more effectively.
potential_concerns: The emphasis on accommodating religious beliefs in foster care placement may lead to exclusion or discrimination against LGBTQ+ individuals or families wanting to foster children, impacting children-minors and caregivers-non-military.
The use of AI and predictive analytics to improve caregiver recruitment and child matching risks unfair biases and privacy issues affecting children-minors and caregivers-non-military.

Reallocating returned federal funds towards financial literacy and career programs might reduce direct support services for some low-income families, potentially disadvantaging children-minors and youth-young-adults currently in foster care.

Increased involvement of faith-based communities may blur lines between church and state, potentially privileging religious organizations over secular support options, which could negatively impact children-minors and low-income-individuals-families relying on foster care services.
The burden of modernizing outdated state-level data systems may result in uneven implementation across states, potentially delaying improvements for some children and youth currently in foster care.
